availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen W. Brown (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, medical student and physician.)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, medical student and physician. Kentucky native. Son of John Brown and Ellen Brown. Attended school in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Medical student in Rockcastle County in 1860. Physician in Rockcastle County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Southern District, p. 173A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mount Vernon, p. 584.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mount Vernon, pp. 34B-35A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Rockcastle County, KY, June 1863, p. 40.
"Buried in Greenville," The Danville Messenger (Danville, KY), November 10, 1914, p. 8.
"Dr Stephen W. Brown (1835-1914)," Find A Grave, Memorial 30736335, accessed September 21, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/30736335.
